getRootCategory

isActive

public boolean isActive()
tests if the category is disabled or not. Note that it does not test this for parent categories. If any parent category is disabled, then logically the child categories are also disabled, even if this is not always updated to these child categories. For this reason, in particular cases it's better to use isEnabled().

Returns:
true if the category is not disabled.

isEnabled

public boolean isEnabled()
tests if this category or any of its parents is active. If a parent category is disabled, then logically the child categories are also disabled, even though these might not be updated. For this reason, this method might be more appropriate than isActive().

Returns:
true if and only if this category and all of it's parents in line are active.
